item.title: Can You Train Your Brain to Ignore Floaters?
item.description:
You’ve probably asked yourself this more than once:

“Can I train my brain to ignore eye floaters?”

The idea is simple — but powerful. If surgery isn’t an option, and floaters are sticking around, maybe your brain can learn to stop caring.

Here’s the good news: Yes, you can train your brain to ignore floaters.
But it’s not about brute force. It’s about psychology, perception, and letting your brain do what it’s built for — adaptation.
